setup.question: What is Androka’s motivation for using the zone of silence?
answers:
He is helping the Nazi war effort
He is planning revenge against the Nazis for harming his family.

Text.text: hehe
Androka's motivation for using the zone of silence is that he is helping the Nazi War Effort.

.

For context the Zone of Silence makes it so that:

.

This is like the most explicit possible round ever. I'm not sure why this question was designed when it is this straight forward. My apologies to B - this round is completely stacked against them - I hope I never flip B on this question.

Androka, a Czech mad scientist, is a double agent for the US. He arrives on a US navy ship to demonstrate a new weapon he has created that silences all radio communication in the area, helps the Nazis take over the ship, and gains the complete trust of a nazi commander in order to sabotage their plans to steal another ship.
Here is ev of his allegiance and his hatred for the Nazis:

A your ev isn't as explicit as I'd like, it says the scientist had his mind turned but that's turned to what side, your ev doesn't say whether Androka is helping the Nazis or not, can you give me explicit ev abt his intentions to help the Nazis

B I need more ev for what's happening to Androka's family and the context around the first quote, since idek if it's Androka saying that.

yeah explicit ev about Androka helping the nazis coming right up.

First Curtis says to Androka about his radio of silence:
Androka responds:

. 
Bradford even comments:
- this is the nail in the coffin as to how Androka's radio of silence prevents the US Navy's from a valuable war-turning opportunity and saves lives for the German Fuhrer himself - Adolf Hitler
First quote is US ship captain Curtis questioning why Androka turned on the radio of silence:
It is implied that the Germans have Androka's family captured in Prague.

His motivation is clear from the first quote. He absolutely despises Nazis for taking over his home, Czech and having his family captured. 

A's quote about "it saved a lot of lives" has nothing to do with the radio of silence, it is a misquote. The full quote is about Androka's invention of a gas to "break up the Maginot Line"

A can you give me the context around the saving a lot of lives quote, if it is a lie that's pretty messed up and you gotta explain that, can you also respond to the quote that Androka talked about the Nazis hatefully

B can you give me more ev for Androka hating the Nazis, if you can't can you respond to some of A's quotes and give me the context around them
huh what is B on about. i didn't misquote anything - further context:

. seems very clear to me.

anyway to line by line B now:
the hatred quote - yea Androka has a lot of hatred for the US which is why his radio of silence wrecks the US ship - the number 1 defence mechanism against Hitler.

the quote about the daughters and family is a misquote/taken out of context by B - this is within the USA who has captured Androka's family which is EXACTLY why he uses the RoS to screw with the US ship.

This clearly works in harming the US effort and supporting the nazi war effort - Curtis asks
3598 has nothing to do with the radio of silence:

This is what I mean by misquoting.

More context on 1639: Androka is a bit of a made scientist, activated RoS as a demonstration of its power:

Dont know what A is on about for hatred for the US. Probably didn't use the quotes feature. Quote right before 2407 is literally Androka stating how his inventions can defeat the Nazis. 

Don't even know how to respond to claim that USA captured Androka's family. very clear that the Germans have Androka's family:

Just realized that all of the stuff about harming family is like "the nazis WILL harm Androka's family," b can you give me ev that he Androka is doing this in revenge for harm that has ALREADY happened?

A just respond to what B has said, also provide ev that Androka's family is in the US and give me the context around it, if you don't give me context I'm j gna vote B bc your quote cutting is pretty sketchy.

that crackpot is Androka. idk why this is being hinged as if ive misrepresented anything when im literally stating facts. 

i feel like an important point of clarity in this story is that Androka claims to be planning revenge against the Nazis but the story's final twist is that Androka is actually helping the Nazi War Effort. thats why theres been so much back and forth - b is arguing from the perspective of how the main characters think but im arguing from the truthful ending.
here's the twist:
. he's the son of a nazi and now himself a nazi.

because you used the quote to try and show "as to how Androka's radio of silence prevents the US... saves lives for Hitler." Im saying that that is a misquote. The ros has nothign to do with your quote. 

Another misquote. A is literally trying to pull wool over your eyes. Yes, its truthful for NELSON, not Androka.
I hear your concern judge. The ev points to a) the Nazi's have his family captured and b) that he wants revenge for what is done to his country.
I agree that answer B would be better worded if it said Androka is planning revenge against Nazi for his family.
yeah idk A has been caught lying way too many times and not providing me proper context, gotta vote B even tho it's more a case of the debate centering on A being wrong rather than B being right.

answers.reason for outcome: A couldn't provide sufficient context for a lot of their quotes and they kept getting called out by B for incomplete quotations

I think debater A def had some quotes that he could've used to really flip the debate on its head. He was also misquoting a lot and i think the judge really didn't like that. Very clear A ev that A didn't use.
